XGBoost Baseline API¶

Dataset helpers reused by the XGBoost baseline.

xgb.data.filter_dataset_for_issue(ds, issue)[source]¶

Return a dataset filtered down to a specific issue label.

Parameters:

  • ds (datasets.DatasetDict)

  • issue (str)

Return type:

datasets.DatasetDict

xgb.data.issues_in_dataset(ds)[source]¶

Return the list of issue labels present in the dataset.

Parameters:

ds (datasets.DatasetDict)

Return type:

List[str]

xgb.data.load_dataset_source(source, cache_dir)[source]¶

Load a cleaned dataset from disk or from the Hugging Face Hub.

Parameters:

  • source (str)

  • cache_dir (str)

Return type:

datasets.DatasetDict

Feature extraction helpers for the XGBoost baseline.

xgb.features.assemble_document(example, extra_fields=None)[source]¶

Return concatenated text used to featurise example.

Parameters:

  • example (dict) – Dataset row containing prompt and slate context.

  • extra_fields (Sequence[str] | None) – Iterable of additional field names to append.

Returns:

Single text string describing the viewer + slate.

Return type:

str

xgb.features.extract_now_watching(example)[source]¶

Return the currently watched title/id, if known.

Parameters:

example (dict) – Dataset row containing now-watching metadata.

Returns:

(title, video_id) tuple when available, otherwise None.

Return type:

Tuple[str, str] | None

xgb.features.extract_slate_items(example)[source]¶

Return the slate as (title, video_id) pairs.

Parameters:

example (dict) – Dataset row containing slate metadata.

Returns:

Ordered list of candidate tuples for the slate.

Return type:

List[Tuple[str, str]]

xgb.features.prepare_prompt_documents(train_ds, max_train, seed, extra_fields=None)[source]¶

Convenience wrapper around knn.features.prepare_training_documents().

Parameters:

  • train_ds (datasets.Dataset or sequence-like) – Dataset providing prompt rows.

  • max_train (int) – Maximum number of rows sampled (0 keeps all rows).

  • seed (int) – Random seed applied during subsampling.

  • extra_fields (Sequence[str], optional) – Optional column names appended to the generated documents.

Returns:

Tuple of documents, canonical video ids, and friendly titles.

Return type:

Tuple[list[str], list[str], list[str]]

xgb.features.prepare_training_documents(train_ds, max_train, seed, extra_fields=None)[source]¶

Return TF-IDF training documents and associated labels.

Parameters:

  • train_ds – Training dataset split.

  • max_train (int) – Maximum number of rows to sample.

  • seed (int) – Random seed for subsampling.

  • extra_fields (Sequence[str] | None) – Optional iterable of additional text fields.

Returns:

Tuple (documents, label_ids, label_titles).

Raises:

RuntimeError – If no valid documents are produced.

xgb.features.prompt_from_builder(example)[source]¶

Return the prompt text for example using the shared builder.

Parameters:

example (dict) – Dataset row used to construct the prompt.

Returns:

Prompt string derived from shared builder logic.

Return type:

str

xgb.features.title_for(video_id)[source]¶

Return a human-readable title for a YouTube id if available.

Parameters:

video_id (str)

Return type:

str | None

xgb.features.viewer_profile_sentence(example)[source]¶

Return the viewer profile sentence for example.

Parameters:

example (dict) – Dataset row containing viewer metadata.

Returns:

Cleaned viewer profile sentence (may be empty).

Return type:

str

XGBoost training and inference utilities for slate prediction.

class xgb.model.XGBoostBoosterParams(learning_rate=0.1, max_depth=6, n_estimators=300, subsample=0.8, colsample_bytree=0.8, tree_method='hist', reg_lambda=1.0, reg_alpha=0.0, extra_kwargs=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

XGBoost-specific hyper-parameters used when instantiating the booster.

Variables:

  • learning_rate (float) – Gradient boosting learning rate.

  • max_depth (int) – Maximum tree depth.

  • n_estimators (int) – Number of boosting rounds.

  • subsample (float) – Row subsampling ratio applied per boosting round.

  • colsample_bytree (float) – Column subsampling ratio applied per tree.

  • tree_method (str) – Tree construction algorithm name.

  • reg_lambda (float) – L2 regularisation weight.

  • reg_alpha (float) – L1 regularisation weight.

  • extra_kwargs (Dict[str, Any] | None) – Additional keyword arguments forwarded to xgboost.XGBClassifier.

Parameters:

  • learning_rate (float)

  • max_depth (int)

  • n_estimators (int)

  • subsample (float)

  • colsample_bytree (float)

  • tree_method (str)

  • reg_lambda (float)

  • reg_alpha (float)

  • extra_kwargs (Dict[str, Any] | None)

colsample_bytree: float = 0.8¶
extra_kwargs: Dict[str, Any] | None = None¶
learning_rate: float = 0.1¶
max_depth: int = 6¶
n_estimators: int = 300¶
reg_alpha: float = 0.0¶
reg_lambda: float = 1.0¶
subsample: float = 0.8¶
tree_method: str = 'hist'¶
class xgb.model.XGBoostSlateModel(vectorizer, label_encoder, booster, extra_fields)[source]¶

Bases: object

Container bundling the vectoriser, label encoder, and trained model.

Variables:

  • vectorizer (sklearn.feature_extraction.text.TfidfVectorizer) – TF-IDF vectoriser fitted on training documents.

  • label_encoder (sklearn.preprocessing.LabelEncoder) – Encoder mapping video identifiers to numeric labels.

  • booster (Any) – Trained XGBoost booster instance.

  • extra_fields (Tuple[str, ...]) – Additional prompt fields captured during training.

Parameters:

  • vectorizer (sklearn.feature_extraction.text.TfidfVectorizer)

  • label_encoder (sklearn.preprocessing.LabelEncoder)

  • booster (Any)

  • extra_fields (Tuple[str, ...])

booster: Any¶
extra_fields: Tuple[str, ...]¶
label_encoder: sklearn.preprocessing.LabelEncoder¶
vectorizer: sklearn.feature_extraction.text.TfidfVectorizer¶
class xgb.model.XGBoostTrainConfig(max_train=200000, seed=42, max_features=200000, booster=<factory>)[source]¶

Bases: object

Configuration options controlling training behaviour.

Variables:

  • max_train (int) – Maximum number of rows sampled from the training split (0 keeps all).

  • seed (int) – Random seed used for subsampling.

  • max_features (int | None) – Maximum number of TF-IDF features (None for unlimited).

  • booster (XGBoostBoosterParams) – Hyper-parameter bundle applied when initialising the booster.

Parameters:

  • max_train (int)

  • seed (int)

  • max_features (int | None)

  • booster (XGBoostBoosterParams)

booster: XGBoostBoosterParams¶
max_features: int | None = 200000¶
max_train: int = 200000¶
seed: int = 42¶
xgb.model.fit_xgboost_model(train_ds, *, config=None, extra_fields=None)[source]¶

Train an XGBoost multi-class classifier over prompt documents.

Parameters:

  • train_ds (datasets.Dataset or sequence-like) – Dataset split providing training examples.

  • config (XGBoostTrainConfig, optional) – Hyper-parameter bundle controlling training behaviour, including subsampling limits and booster hyper-parameters.

  • extra_fields (Sequence[str], optional) – Optional column names appended to the prompt document.

Returns:

Trained model bundle containing vectoriser, label encoder, and booster.

Return type:

XGBoostSlateModel

Raises:

  • ImportError – If the upstream xgboost package is unavailable.

  • RuntimeError – When the training split is empty or lacks diverse labels.

xgb.model.load_xgboost_model(in_dir)[source]¶

Load an XGBoost model bundle previously saved to disk.

Parameters:

in_dir (Path or str) – Directory containing the saved bundle.

Returns:

Restored model bundle.

Return type:

XGBoostSlateModel

xgb.model.predict_among_slate(model, example, *, extra_fields=None)[source]¶

Predict which slate option should be selected for example.

Parameters:

  • model (XGBoostSlateModel) – Trained model bundle used for inference.

  • example (dict) – Interaction row containing prompt text and candidate slate.

  • extra_fields (Sequence[str], optional) – Optional override of additional columns appended during inference.

Returns:

Tuple with a 1-based predicted option index (None when unknown) and per-video probabilities.

Return type:

Tuple[Optional[int], Dict[str, float]]

xgb.model.save_xgboost_model(model, out_dir)[source]¶

Persist a trained XGBoost model bundle to out_dir.

Parameters:

  • model (XGBoostSlateModel) – Model bundle produced by fit_xgboost_model().

  • out_dir (Path or str) – Directory path where the bundle should be written.

Return type:

None

Evaluation loop and metrics for the XGBoost slate baseline.

class xgb.evaluate.EvaluationConfig(dataset_source, extra_fields, eval_max)[source]¶

Bases: object

Configuration bundle shared across evaluation helpers.

Variables:

  • dataset_source (str) – Identifier for the dataset source (path or HF id).

  • extra_fields (Sequence[str]) – Additional column names appended to prompt documents.

  • eval_max (int) – Optional cap on the number of evaluation rows (0 evaluates all).

Parameters:

  • dataset_source (str)

  • extra_fields (Sequence[str])

  • eval_max (int)

dataset_source: str¶
eval_max: int¶
extra_fields: Sequence[str]¶
class xgb.evaluate.IssueMetrics(issue, dataset_source, evaluated, correct, accuracy, known_candidate_hits, known_candidate_total, coverage, avg_probability, timestamp, extra_fields, xgboost_params)[source]¶

Bases: object

Container describing evaluation metrics for a single issue.

Parameters:

  • issue (str)

  • dataset_source (str)

  • evaluated (int)

  • correct (int)

  • accuracy (float)

  • known_candidate_hits (int)

  • known_candidate_total (int)

  • coverage (float)

  • avg_probability (float)

  • timestamp (float)

  • extra_fields (Sequence[str])

  • xgboost_params (Dict[str, Any])

accuracy: float¶
avg_probability: float¶
correct: int¶
coverage: float¶
dataset_source: str¶
evaluated: int¶
extra_fields: Sequence[str]¶
issue: str¶
known_candidate_hits: int¶
known_candidate_total: int¶
timestamp: float¶
xgboost_params: Dict[str, Any]¶
xgb.evaluate.evaluate_issue(*, model, eval_ds, issue_slug, config)[source]¶

Evaluate a trained XGBoost model on the provided evaluation split.

Parameters:

  • model (XGBoostSlateModel) – Trained model bundle used to score slate options.

  • eval_ds (datasets.Dataset or sequence-like) – Dataset split representing evaluation rows.

  • issue_slug (str) – Slug-ified representation of the issue being evaluated.

  • config (EvaluationConfig) – Evaluation configuration bundle (dataset info, extra fields, limits).

Returns:

Pair of summary metrics and per-example prediction details.

Return type:

tuple[IssueMetrics, List[Dict[str, Any]]]

xgb.evaluate.run_eval(args)[source]¶

Evaluate the XGBoost baseline across the requested issues.

Parameters:

args (argparse.Namespace) – Parsed CLI arguments produced via xgb.cli.build_parser().

Return type:

None

xgb.evaluate.safe_div(numerator, denominator, *, default=0.0)[source]¶

Return the division result guarding against a zero denominator.

Parameters:

  • numerator (float) – Value forming the numerator.

  • denominator (float) – Value forming the denominator.

  • default (float) – Fallback value returned when denominator is zero.

Return type:

float

Command-line interface for the XGBoost slate baseline.

xgb.cli.build_parser()[source]¶

Return the argument parser for the XGBoost baseline CLI.

Returns:

Configured argument parser exposing training and evaluation options.

Return type:

argparse.ArgumentParser

xgb.cli.main(argv=None)[source]¶

Parse CLI arguments and execute the evaluation routine.

Parameters:

argv (list[str], optional) – Optional override for command-line arguments.

Return type:

None

Utility helpers shared across the XGBoost baseline modules.

xgb.utils.canon_video_id(value)[source]¶

Normalise a YouTube id when present in value.

Parameters:

value (object | None)

Return type:

str

xgb.utils.ensure_directory(path)[source]¶

Create path (including parents) when it does not already exist.

Parameters:

path (Path | str) – Target directory to ensure.

Return type:

None

xgb.utils.get_logger(name, *, level=20)[source]¶

Return a memoised logger configured with a simple stream handler.

The helper mirrors the historical behaviour from the individual baselines: create a logging.Logger, attach a stream handler when none are registered yet, and set the level to INFO (or a caller-provided override).

Parameters:

  • name (str)

  • level (int)

Return type:

Logger
